Class SeatManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • SeatManager
  • public class SeatManager
extends Object
    This class models the SeatManager of the Airplane where you can set the size of it; sit passengers; fill the airplane; print the seats...

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static char ADULT_SYMBOL
      It's the symbol for the seats where an adult is sit
      static byte ALL_CLASSES
      It's the value assigned to the area of all the classes
      static byte BOARD_WINDOW
      It's the value assigned to the board window section
      static byte BOTH_AISLES
      It's the value assigned to the section of both aisles
      static byte BOTH_WINDOWS
      It's the value assigned to the section of boath windows
      static char CHILDREN_SYMBOL
      It's the symbol for the seats where a child is sit
      static char EMPTY_SYMBOL
      It's the symbol for the empty seats
      static String ERROR_HIGHER_COLUMN
      It's the error message thrown when you want to access a column that is greater than the number of columns in the seatManage
      static String ERROR_HIGHER_PASSENGERS
      It's the error message thrown when you want to sit a number of passengers that is greater than the number of seats available
      static String ERROR_HIGHER_ROW
      It's the error message thrown when you want to access a row that is greater than the number of rows in the seatManager
      static String ERROR_INCORRECT_AREA
      It's the error message thrown when you want to access an area that doesn't exist
      static String ERROR_INCORRECT_SECTION
      It's the error message thrown when you want to access a section that doesn't exist
      static String ERROR_NEGATIVE_COLUMN
      It's the error message thrown when you want to access a column that is negative
      static String ERROR_NEGATIVE_FIRST_CLASS
      It's the error message thrown when the number of first Class Rows is negative
      static String ERROR_NEGATIVE_PASSENGERS
      It's the error message thrown when you want to sit a negative number of passengers
      static String ERROR_NEGATIVE_ROW
      It's the error message thrown when you want to access a row that is negative
      static String ERROR_NEGATIVE_STANDARD_CLASS
      It's the error message thrown when the number of standard Class Rows is negative
      static String ERROR_NO_EMPTY_SEAT
      It's the error message thrown when you want to reserved a seat that is not empty
      static String ERROR_NULL_PASSENGER
      It's the error message thrown when you want to sit a Person that is null
      static byte EVERYWHERE
      It's the value assigned to all the sections
      static byte FIRST_CLASS
      It's the value assigned to the first class area
      static byte LEFT_AISLE
      It's the value assigned to the left aisle section
      static byte RIGHT_AISLE
      It's the value assigned to the right aisle section
      static char[] SEAT_LABELS
      They are the letters of the columns of the seats
      static byte STANDARD_CLASS
      It's the value assigned to the standard class area
      static byte STARBOARD_WINDOW
      It's the value assigned to the starboard window section
      static int WIDTH
      It's the width of the seats (the number of columns)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SeatManager​(int firstClassRows, int standardClassRows)
      Constructor that creates a SeatManger with a given number of first class rows and a given number of standard class rows.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void bookSeat​(Person person, int row, int col)
      Assigns a given seat to a given person when the seat exists and the seat is not already reserved.
      int countFirstClassElderlyPax​(boolean gender)
      Counts the number of passengers in the first class (by gender) whose age is over 65
      protected Person[] getCol​(int col)
      Returns the given column as a list of passengers
      int getNumPax()
      Returns the number of passengers of all the Airplane
      int getNumPax​(byte area)
      Returns the number of passengers of a given area that can be: FIRST_CLASS, STANDARD_CLASS or ALL_CLASSES
      int getNumPax​(byte area, byte section)
      Returns the number of passengers of a given area that can be: FIRST_CLASS, STANDARD_CLASS or ALL_CLASSES and a given section that can be: STARBOARD_WINDOW (right), BOARD_WINDOW (left), BOTH_WINDOWS, LEFT_AISLE, RIGHT_AISLE, BOTH_AISLES or EVERYWHERE
      Person getReservation​(int row, int col)
      Returns the Person that has booked the seat
      protected Person[] getRow​(int row)
      Returns the given row as a list of passengers
      int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows that are in the airplane
      int getRowsFirstClass()
      Returns the number of first class rows that are in the airplane
      int getRowsStandardClass()
      Returns the number of standard class rows that are in the airplane
      int getSize()
      Returns the number of seats that are in the airplane
      int getSizeFirstClass()
      Returns the number of first class seats that are in the airplane
      int getSizeStandardClass()
      Returns the number of standard class seats that are in the airplane
      int getYoungestAgeOnBoard()
      Returns the youngest age on board
      ArrayList<Person> getYoungestPeopleOnBoard()
      Returns a list containing the youngest people on board
      void interchangeSeats​(int colA, int colB)
      Interchanges the seats of the passengers in A and B
      boolean isReserved​(int row, int col)
      Checks if a given seat is reserved or not.
      void loadPax​(int paxNumber)
      Fills distributed(randomly) the airplane with a given number of virtual passenger
      void loadPaxNotDistributed​(int paxNumber)
      Fills in order the airplane with a given number of virtual passengers
      void print()
      Prints a drawing of the seats of the airplane indicating the empty seats, adults and children
      void printManifest()
      Prints the manifest of the airplane.
      void releaseSeat​(int row, int col)
      Releases a given seat (cancels the reservation)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SeatManager

        public SeatManager​(int firstClassRows,
                   int standardClassRows)
        Constructor that creates a SeatManger with a given number of first class rows and a given number of standard class rows. If this numbers are negative, an error will appear
        Parameters:
        firstClassRows - It's the number of first class rows that will have the SeatManager
        standardClassRows - It's the number of standard class rows that will have the SeatManager

      • bookSeat

        public void bookSeat​(Person person,
                     int row,
                     int col)
        Assigns a given seat to a given person when the seat exists and the seat is not already reserved. If not a error message will appear.
        Parameters:
        person - It's the person that books that seat
        row - It's the number of the row of the seat
        col - It's the number of the column of the seat

      • isReserved

        public boolean isReserved​(int row,
                          int col)
        Checks if a given seat is reserved or not.
        Parameters:
        row - It's the number of the row of the seat
        col - It's the number of the column of the seat
        Returns:
        True if the seat is not empty (not reserved)

      • getReservation

        public Person getReservation​(int row,
                             int col)
        Returns the Person that has booked the seat
        Parameters:
        row - It's the number of the row of the seat
        col - It's the number of the column of the seat
        Returns:
        The person that has booked the seat

      • releaseSeat

        public void releaseSeat​(int row,
                        int col)
        Releases a given seat (cancels the reservation)
        Parameters:
        row - It's the number of the row of the seat
        col - It's the number of the column of the seat

      • getNumPax

        public int getNumPax()
        Returns the number of passengers of all the Airplane
        Returns:
        The number of passengers

      • getNumPax

        public int getNumPax​(byte area)
        Returns the number of passengers of a given area that can be: FIRST_CLASS, STANDARD_CLASS or ALL_CLASSES
        Parameters:
        area - It's the area where do you want to count the passengers
        Returns:
        The number of passengers of that area

      • getNumPax

        public int getNumPax​(byte area,
                     byte section)
        Returns the number of passengers of a given area that can be: FIRST_CLASS, STANDARD_CLASS or ALL_CLASSES and a given section that can be: STARBOARD_WINDOW (right), BOARD_WINDOW (left), BOTH_WINDOWS, LEFT_AISLE, RIGHT_AISLE, BOTH_AISLES or EVERYWHERE
        Parameters:
        area - It's the area where do you want to count the passengers
        section - It's the section where do you want to count the passengers
        Returns:
        The number of passengers of that area and that section

      • loadPaxNotDistributed

        public void loadPaxNotDistributed​(int paxNumber)
        Fills in order the airplane with a given number of virtual passengers
        Parameters:
        paxNumber - It's the number of passengers that you want to sit

      • loadPax

        public void loadPax​(int paxNumber)
        Fills distributed(randomly) the airplane with a given number of virtual passenger
        Parameters:
        paxNumber - It's the number of passengers that you want to sit

      • printManifest

        public void printManifest()
        Prints the manifest of the airplane. It's divided by class and it shows the seat, name, surname and age of every passenger

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints a drawing of the seats of the airplane indicating the empty seats, adults and children

      • getYoungestAgeOnBoard

        public int getYoungestAgeOnBoard()
        Returns the youngest age on board
        Returns:
        The youngest age. Returns -1 if there's nobody on board

      • getYoungestPeopleOnBoard

        public ArrayList<Person> getYoungestPeopleOnBoard()
        Returns a list containing the youngest people on board
        Returns:
        A list containing the youngest people on board

      • countFirstClassElderlyPax

        public int countFirstClassElderlyPax​(boolean gender)
        Counts the number of passengers in the first class (by gender) whose age is over 65
        Parameters:
        gender - It's the gender of the passengers that you are going to check if the are over 65
        Returns:
        The number of passengers in the first class (by gender) whose age is over 65

      • interchangeSeats

        public void interchangeSeats​(int colA,
                             int colB)
        Interchanges the seats of the passengers in A and B
        Parameters:
        colA - It's one of the given columns
        colB - It's the other given column
